TopicTitle: [0.23.5] Green Skull Inc. Custom Design Spacesuits - v0.38 - 14th April 14

Articles.Content:
There may or may not be a James Bond themed pack planned. I haven't decided yet

My favourite Bond film.

Stoland look forward to seeing em!

Excuse me for be a killjoy, but you have committed various license violations here https://www.dropbox.com/s/ivsaaqrz3u6dknc/Green%20Skull%20READ%20ME.txt for example, trying to relicense the base pack.

I told you: you can even call for donations meanwhile you don't try to sell it in any way, but you have two more obligations clearly defined under the 4.0 CC BY-NC-SA license...

Attribution: appropriate credit, not only name me or a link to my originals.

"unique textures, patches, badges" Is not very fair with the originals, but also with the real patches and badges (with material copyrighted by USA and Russia space agencies).

Too: (in determinate contexts, like here) rationally indicating what-and-where changes were made. (Example: "X original texture: tone changed, X patches added")

This is very logical in a free license, because you don't need my permission to modify my contents; but/and I don't need to agree with your changes. And people need to know a rationally time-line/change-log about all that.

If distribution easy material like this is a mess without timeline/changelog, imagine things like code...

ShareAlike: anything you gonna do with the material must be distributed under the same license as the original. Again: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/deed.en_US#

You can't say:

"Textures may be modified for personal use only. Textures may not be redistributed without permission.

Green Skull Inc All Rights Reserved March 2014"

It's contradictory and not possible. Can you modify my textures as you wish, but the people can't modify yours?

Where freedom of the original license is?

Edited, thank you Green Skull.

Edited March 15, 2014 by Proot

Wow, that's a disappointment, if it's not available maybe you shouldn't make it the first picture on the page. It would save the rest of us from having to read 7 pages of posts to find that out.

The suit customisation can be done......My attempt though not that good. Can't wait for the next release from Green Skull.

Firstly I must apologise. The licence has been changed. For the record released patches come from here http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Main_Page or they are made by me. My intentiom was for people to ask so I could explain the situation and notify you.

Firstly I must apologise. The licence has been changed. For the record released patches come from here http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Main_Page or they are made by me. My intentiom was for people to ask so I could explain the situation and notify you.

Thank you for attend the request so fast.

Thank you for attend the request so fast.

No problem at all. Thank you again for letting me use your textures!

Yeah I did they were great and worked like a charm I noticed however that some of the env maps that I sent you are actually wrong orientated, it's hard to see but they are and i"m gonna try to figure it out and I'll send you the correct ones (and I'll be sure to resize them down to 64x64)

Ok the release version of the Black GSI suit is nearly done and will be released in the next update along with Sippyfrogs awesome skybox visor reflection and a bunch of visor star reflections I've been working on including Blue, Coloured and White Star sets. Plus more suits in developement!

Working on a new update. Release soon!
Question: how do I give Jeb or another Kerbal a custom suit?

Quick answer assuming you downloaded a pack - Open the TextureReplacer file in your Game Data folder, open Customkerbals folder. Open Jebediah Kerman folder. Open alternate texture folder that came in download folder and find replacement suit. Copy both files and paste into Jebs folder replacing existing. Suit is now changed. For full instructions see READ ME or ask back here if you have further problems.
INTRODUCING THE MEGA PACK DOWNLOAD - NOW AVAILABLE ON MAIN PAGE - GET YOUR BLACK GREEN SKULL INC SUITS HERE!

This is just way to cool, way to fun and way to nice.

One hell of a job GreenSkull.

Very much enjoyed.
Koviet Union Mun landing mission with Lunokhod 1 rover. Koviet parts by Bobcat. Suits by me!
After watching Dispicable Me 2 last night, I have a strong want to have minions as my crews.

After watching Dispicable Me 2 last night, I have a strong want to have minions as my crews.

*moment of realization*

IT'S POSSIBLE

Yes but only the one with two eyes...

It can and will be done because KSP NEEDS Minions!

Edited March 23, 2014 by Green Skull

Kerbals are green minions...

...Then who is Gru?

*** Update ***

This is proving a challenge as kerbal and minion heads are different shapes and sizes. The eye spacing is very different on a kerbal but I'm still in the early developement phase....

Might want to check out the Copyright and other legal 'stuff' on those little yellow dudes... Those movie companies and types can get 'perturbed' by the simplest of things. I was trying to find a pattern for my wife to make a gift and we got 'slapped' for even asking for such... Unless went through proper 'paid' for means....

your stuff is awesome. dont want to see anything bad happen...

cheers.
